name: International Rescue Committee
mission: The International Rescue Committee (IRC) responds to the world's worst humanitarian crises, helping to restore health, safety, education, economic well being, and power to people devastated by conflict and disaster. Founded in 1933 at the call of Albert Einstein, the IRC is at work in over 40 countries and 26 U.S. cities helping people to survive, reclaim control of their future and strengthen their communities.
theoryOfChange: The International Rescue Committee (IRC) has a published 'Outcomes and Evidence Framework' (OEF) which serves as a strategic framework for guiding program decisions and designing effective programs. This interactive tool delivers key information on outcomes related to health, safety, education, economic wellbeing, and power through theories of change that demonstrate how to achieve these outcomes. The IRC systematically uses theories of change in all its new project designs to ensure outcome-driven and evidence-based projects. The OEF also includes core indicators to measure the change in outcomes over time. Additionally, the IRC utilizes an 'IMPACT Program Quality Framework' which defines program quality through six principles and supports the goals of their broader 'Strategy100'.
zakatClaimEvidence: The IRC has worked with Islamic scholars and has received a fatwa confirming the IRC as a legitimate recipient of Zakat. We have launched a pilot Fund for Ramadan this year. IRC will accept Zakat each year during Ramadan, starting in February 2026, the month of Ramadan. (Source: https://rescue.org/sites/default/files/document/3747/tuungane2-evaluationfinalreport.pdf)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

alignment.rationale: Alignment 41/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build reserves toward your board-approved target range (often 3-12 months), adjusted for revenue volatility and obligations.
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: International Rescue Committee, Inc. shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

IRC will accept Zakat each year during Ramadan, starting in February 2026, the month of Ramadan. (Source: https://rescue.org/sites/default/files/document/3747/tuungane2-evaluationfinalreport.pdf)

all_citations.claim: The IRC maintains a 97.0/100 score and an 87.7% program expense ratio.
The organization reported Total Revenue of $1,341,268,864.
IRC programs lead to an average increase in credit scores and liquid assets for clients.
Audited data tracks the average increase in liquid assets for program participants.
Impact evaluations show increases in community meetings and positive villager ratings of service quality.
all_citations.source_name: Report: Participatory Development in Fragile and Conflict-affected Contexts

all_citations.claim: The organization provides various giving methods and is recognized as Zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The IRC earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial transparency, efficient use of donor funds, and its status as a Zakat-eligible organization serving urgent humanitarian needs.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively lean liquidity with 2.4 months of working capital
High cost per beneficiary due to the complex nature of direct humanitarian provision in conflict zones

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors seeking to address urgent humanitarian crises and is designated as Zakat-eligible [6]. Its long track record in fragile contexts is supported by participatory development evaluations that highlight improved community engagement and service quality [5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The IRC demonstrates high impact through direct provision of services, maintaining a program expense ratio of 87.7% [1][2]. Evaluations of its economic programs show measurable improvements in participants' financial health, including increases in liquid assets and credit scores [3][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: The International Rescue Committee provides life-saving assistance and long-term recovery solutions to people displaced by conflict and natural disasters worldwide.
strengths: High financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 87.7%
Excellent fundraising efficiency of $0.06 per $1 raised
Strong accountability and transparency with a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100
baseline_narrative.summary: The International Rescue Committee (IRC) helps individuals affected by humanitarian crises survive and rebuild their lives through programs focused on safety, empowerment, and economic wellbeing [1][5]. In the most recent fiscal period, the organization reported a Total Revenue of $1,341,268,864 to support its global operations [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The IRC earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial transparency, efficient use of donor funds, and its status as a Zakat-eligible organization serving urgent humanitarian needs.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization operates with <cite id="1">2.4 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, which is relatively lean for its size.
Due to the complex nature of direct humanitarian provision in conflict zones, the cost per beneficiary averages <cite id="5">$22,486.45</cite>.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could expand public reporting on localized impact metrics.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Strong outcome tracking and external evaluations

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Primarily direct provision of services rather than grantmaking.

rich_narrative.headline: The International Rescue Committee provides life-saving assistance and long-term recovery solutions to people displaced by conflict and natural disasters worldwide.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support a massive, highly efficient humanitarian machine capable of delivering zakat-eligible aid in the world's most complex crisis zones.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations through a highly established institution
Value exceptional financial efficiency and low fundraising costs
Care deeply about global humanitarian crises and refugee support
giving_considerations: Individual gifts join a massive billion-dollar pooled fund
High cost per beneficiary due to the complexity of operating in active conflict zones
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking hyperlocal community impact or those who prefer supporting small, grassroots organizations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks multiple outcome metrics and participates in external evaluations, such as the Tuungane 2 program assessment.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The IRC aims to make its programs a model for global humanitarian response by delivering high-quality, cost-effective interventions.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Rigorous evidence ensures that interventions in complex humanitarian settings actually improve lives rather than causing unintended harm.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a massive global organization responding to escalating worldwide crises, the IRC has significant capacity to absorb additional funding.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: United States, Asia, Europe, Africa, South America

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="2">87.7% to program expenses</cite>, significantly outperforming the industry standard.
The IRC operates with remarkable fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="1">$0.06 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity has earned a <cite id="1">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.

strengths_deep_dive: The International Rescue Committee stands out for its ability to manage a billion-dollar budget with extreme efficiency. By maintaining a <cite id="2">87.7% program expense ratio</cite>, the IRC ensures that the vast majority of donor funds directly support humanitarian interventions. Their operations are backed by strong governance, evidenced by a <cite id="2">35-member board</cite> and a <cite id="1">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. Furthermore, the organization has demonstrated consistent growth, achieving an <cite id="2">18.8% revenue CAGR</cite> over the past three years.
rich_narrative.summary: The International Rescue Committee (IRC) is a global humanitarian organization that helps individuals affected by crises survive and rebuild their lives. Founded in <cite id="6">1933</cite>, the organization operates on a massive scale, reporting <cite id="2">$1,341,268,864 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. The IRC demonstrates exceptional financial efficiency, directing <cite id="2">87.7% to program expenses</cite> and maintaining an impressive fundraising efficiency of <cite id="1">$0.06 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization holds a <cite id="1">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and meets <cite id="1">all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards</cite>. The IRC provides direct provision of services across multiple continents, including critical areas like Gaza, Afghanistan, and Yemen. Furthermore, the organization is <cite id="6">zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting large-scale humanitarian relief. Over the past three years, the IRC has experienced significant growth, with a <cite id="2">18.8% revenue CAGR</cite>, reflecting strong donor trust and expanding operational capacity.
